8.「<%sM_PRIZE> ですね。| はい！ どうぞっ！|<break>: <%sM_PRIZE>, is it?|Very good! Here you are!|<break>

11.「どの内容について 説明を聞きますか？|<select_se_off>|景品受け: What would you like to hear about?|<select_se_off>|What is a prize collection counter?|Receiving|<select_end><close>

12.「はい こちら すごろく景品の| 受け取りカウンターについてですね。|<br>|:
Yes, this is the backgammon prize collection|counter... If you can't keep your prizes|after playing backgammon, we'll hold them for|

|prizes due to the passage of time...

13.「かしこまりました。| 景品の 受け取りについて| ご説明させていただきますね。:
Yes, sir... I'd like to explain how to|receive your prizes... When you play a|backgammon game, the maximum number of prizes|
|you can keep is 7. Therefore, until you|receive all your prizes, you cannot play|another game of backgammon... When you play|
|backgammon again, you must receive all the|prizes before you can play...

14.「いらっしゃいませ。こちらは| すごろく景品 受け取りカウンターです。| 本日は: Welcome. This is the Sugoroku Prize Counter.|How can I help you today?|<break>

15.「いらっしゃいませ！ こちらは| すごろく景品 受け取りカウンターです。|<br:
Welcome! This is the Sugoroku Prize Counter.|
|Since this is your first time, I'll give a|brief explanation. This is a temporary storage|for prizes you couldn't receive in Sugoroku.|
|If you're carrying too many items when|you receive your prizes, they'll come here.|
|Please be mindful that if you have any prizes|being held here, you won't be able to play|Sugoroku until you pick them up.|
|If you need another explanation, please speak|to me again. I hope you'll enjoy yourself|here!|

18.「おや？| どうやら 前回のプレイの報酬が| 正常に受け取れなかったみたいですね: Hmm? Well, it looks like you didn't receive|your reward for your last play. The items you|didn't receive will be held here for you...|

20.「選びなおされるのですね。| それでは どちらにいたしますか？|<break>: You'll have to choose again... So, which|would you prefer?<break>

21.「かしこまりました。| では <%sM_PRIZE>を| お渡しさせていただきま: Understood. Then, I'll give the|<%sM_PRIZE> to you.
